intro: Astragalus ankylotus, commonly known as the narrow-leaf milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small, yellow or greenish pods that contain several seeds. Astragalus ankylotus plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local wildlife in its native range.
